snippet: Beyond the bank's letters, lobbying and trips to Capitol Hill to fight what it sees as excessive regulation, JPMorgan's chief has repeatedly taken his case to the public, in a succession of interviews. Here are three of them.
abstract: Beyond the bank's letters, lobbying and trips to Capitol Hill to fight what it sees as excessive regulation, JPMorgan's chief has repeatedly taken his case to the public, in a succession of interviews. Here are three of them.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

headline.main: Dimon vs. Volcker, the Television Series

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
